mainBoard.flavorText: Some mages do their best work in solitude. Others do their best work creating it.

foreignData.flavorText: Einige Magier brauchen Einsamkeit, um effektiv arbeiten zu können. Andere sind sehr effektiv darin, Einsamkeit zu erzeugen.
foreignData.name: Meister des Äthers
foreignData.text: Wenn der Meister des Äthers ins Spiel kommt, bringe eine Kreatur deiner Wahl auf die Hand ihres Besitzers zurück.

foreignData.flavorText: Algunos magos trabajan mejor en soledad. Otros trabajan mejor creándola.

foreignData.flavorText: Certains mages travaillent mieux dans la solitude. D'autres font tout leur possible pour la créer.

foreignData.flavorText: Alcuni maghi lavorano meglio in solitudine. Altri lavorano meglio a crearla.

foreignData.flavorText: Некоторые маги лучше всего творят в одиночестве. Другие же лучше всего творят само одиночество.

mainBoard.originalText: Tap all creatures target player controls. Those creatures don't untap during that player's next untap step.

rulings.text: The second part of Sleep’s ability affects all creatures the targeted player controls as Sleep resolves, not only the ones that Sleep actually caused to become tapped.

mainBoard.name: Narcolepsy
mainBoard.originalText:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, if enchanted creature is untapped, tap it.

rulings.text: Narcolepsy doesn’t keep the enchanted creature continually tapped. The creature untaps during its controller’s untap step as normal, then is tapped when Narcolepsy’s ability resolves during that upkeep. The creature may be tapped in response (for example, if it has an activated ability with {T} in its cost).

Narcolepsy’s triggered ability has an “intervening ‘if’ clause.” That means (1) the ability triggers only if the enchanted creature is untapped as any player’s upkeep begins, and (2) the ability does nothing if the enchanted creature is already tapped by the time it resolves.

mainBoard.text:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of each upkeep, if enchanted creature is untapped, tap it.
